I am developing a Swing console, called TestUI, that will allow you
> to
> =
>> visually see the results of your tests, the tests that failed and those

rules).

olves my problem

modules, and a
> total
> >> number of 800 unit tests. I would like to globa=
lly hook up my
> >> TestUIAgentRule, to report to my TestUI console each te=
st that is
> executed.

om Maven, during build sessions.

> global
> >> mechanism to enable a Rule for =
all the executed tests.

r idea: having a junit

suggested on this message
> >> group that junit should have a configuration=
 file, and I am PRO this

 (available soomewhere in the classpath, like the

e could specifiy:

lobal rules
> >> > - test suites to run/exclude
> >> > - categories to run/=
exclude

> >> > This could also solve this problem:
> >> http://tech.=
groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/22184. The request
> here
> >> (read t=
he first post in the thread) asks for a GUI where unit tests
> could be
> >=
> disabled, like light bulbs (PS: my TestUI console will be able to do
> th=
is,
> >> sometime in the
> >> > future releases).
> >> >
> >> > What do you=
 think of this?

> >> > Cheers,
